CatDescriptText: Ruth Sachnoff, political worker and Stevenson headquarters and Alan Lefkowitz, Stevenson campaign worker, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, July 16, 1960, pg. A1 with question: "What do you think the main issues will be, or should be, in the coming presidential campaign?" Ms. Sachnoff's answer reads: "Foreign policy is a major issue, because of the state of the world as it is today  We can no longer think of ourselves in terms of a nation, but rather we must  think of our part in the world. This is the most important issue."  Mr. Lefkowitz's answer reads: "(1) Foreign affairs, (2) Unemployment, (3) Farm problem.  Have the problems of foreign affairs, unemployment nad the farm policies been handled with responsibility under the present administration?"
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Ruth Sachnoff wearing light colored short sleeve blouse, standing in front of Adlai Stevenson campaign headquarters; Portrait of Alan Lefkowitz wearing dark suit jacket and eyeglasses, standing in front of Adlai Stevenson campaign headquarters
